Text: Capital IT Projects Cc Attached is a list of proposed capital IT projects for This list has been developed by the Commercial Support Systems group and is not intended to be a complete list Please review the list and let me know if there are additional projects to add or there is a concern with projects on the list I expect that we will discuss in Shelleys staff meeting tomorrow morning Thanks Brad

RE NNG Letter asking for Written Clarifications Cc Our recommended language to his request ETS is in the process of evaluating the feedback and system requests from the NNG Winter Operations meeting A system enhancement to notify shippers when they have nominated to an alternate receipt or delivery point that is not on their contract is on the list for consideration The requirements for this modification are currently being determined however the exact method and wording of the message has not been finalized It is anticipated that the enhancement will be installed in the first quarter of Let me know if you have any questions Brad Original Message From Mercaldo Vernon Sent Friday September AM To Blair Lynn Holmes Bradley Subject FW NNG Letter asking for Written Clarifications Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday September AM To Williams Jo Miller Kent Mercaldo Vernon Cc George Briden Subject NNG Letter asking for Written Clarifications Jo Kent Vernon Good morning Hope all is going well in Omaha and Houston As we discussed at lunch in Kansas City we were going to request some information from you in writing and to that extent please see the attached fileSee attached file Northern Letter asking for clarificationdoc Greg Hathaway Virginia Power Energy Marketing VPEM Dominion Blvd Glen Allen Virginia Innsbrook rd Floor

RE All tests were not completely successfully Cc The Help Desk did not receive calls on either of these items this morning That is positive and demonstrates that we have a process in place to resolve issues before a customer places a call I do think it is important to know how were these resolved what caused them and how can they be avoided in the future Brad Original Message From Smith Chris A Sent Wednesday October AM To Hottap HelpDesk Kuehl Toby Holmes Bradley Buchanan John Kowalke Terry Schoolcraft Darrell Blair Lynn Nacey Sheila Cc Abshire Scott Hotte Steve Sawyer Lisa McFarland Jean Kedwaii Hasan Wagner Glenda Subject All tests were not completely successfully All testing was performed and was successful except for the following although ENW Resolution Center confirmed that Exchange servers are up they have received reports that some people get a login screen when trying to access their Outlook They are instructing their users to cancel by the message We have not observed this problem in ETS while attempting to access the Flow Gas application we were unable to hit wwwinfosourcecom We paged the Business Objects oncall pager and will continue to follow up

Outbound TMS Messages Cc With yesterdays email outage behind us I think we need to investigate the ability to keep outbound TMS messages and Critical Notices flowing during these periods of virus infiltration TMS generates cut notices after each scheduling cycle and with extended outages of mailmanenroncom we are losing a critical channel of communication to customers Customers rely on these messages to inform them of business changes In addition ETS critical notices generated by X cannot be sent out during these periods They are called critical notices because of the immediacy of when a customer needs to react I do think we need to know the following Could a message generated by TMS cause further infection of the email systems Can the critical notices cause further infection of Enrons email systems Is it possible to keep outbound messages from systems other than Exchange flowing during virus interruptions This is a significant reliability issue and ETS customer communications were disrupted for approximately hours yesterday Please let me know how we should proceed
Oh the tangled web we weaveyahoomarketsdetoxhtml This is the link to the pipeline deal I was trying to describe this morning

RE A draft Business Continuity Plan for a Short or No Notice Evacuation of the Enron Building Cc Good job on these I think they will give Shelley comfort that a plan has been created We will discuss these with her at her update meeting this morning and determine the next steps Tuesday meeting drill date etc Brad Original Message From Kenagy Gary Sent Friday November PM To Corman Shelley Hotte Steve Holmes Bradley Blair Lynn January Steve Bryant Mike Buchanan John Cc Abshire Scott Sawyer Lisa Kedwaii Hasan Hagen Bob McFarland Jean Rahn Nick Subject A draft Business Continuity Plan for a Short or No Notice Evacuation of the Enron Building Bob Jean Scott and I drafted this up They are intended to be the front and back for laminated cards They provide the plan for responding to a very short notice or no notice evacuation of the Enron Building The first card is for what I have called we can rename the group the BCP st Responders This would include the BCP Directors and Coordinators ETS Business and IT Team Leads Mgrs Dirs VPs and key staff and ENW Contacts The second card is for the OCC The third card is for the remainder of the ETS BCP Team members both Business and IT staff Jean is touching up the OCC ETS BCP defined call burst groups and messages to match this process Bob and I will be completing the Hangar Offsite layout setup process teams and other documentation on Monday We will get the documentation mounted and stored at the Hangar for use during an activation We will also get the equipment stored at the Hangar There is a meeting planned for Tuesday at which we should be able to finalize the initial process and schedule the first test Get us your comments on the attachments We tried to keep it short and simple but with enough detail to avoid confusion during such an event Thanks Gary File ETS Gas Logistics BC Plan stResp OCC Teamdoc
PAAs for Kathy and LyndaAttached are the two PAAs for the above individuals I followed the recommendation of Ramona for consistency purposes and recommended at Let me know if you have any comments

RE Draft For Your ReviewLooks good to me Original Message From Corman Shelley Sent Monday November PM To Bryant Mike Blair Lynn Holmes Bradley January Steve Nacey Sheila Subject Draft For Your Review File YEAR END PROCESS REVIEWdoc
ETS Recall NOPR CommentsFor your reading pleasure and further distribution

TW Negotiated Rate Settlement Offer Cc All As part of the TW Negotiated Rate Settlement Hearing it has been suggested that the following modification to CAS and other associated systems be made EBB sytem that allows a shipper interested in capacity to simply enter a receipt and delivery point the system will automatically let the interested shipper know how much if any capacity is available advantage although it doesnt provide the ISs the last look auction their looking for it at least provides an open process for anybody that is interested to find out if capacity is available eliminates any claim of tortious process disadvantage feasibility and cost are unknown at this time This was drafted by an attorney without considerable consultation with Gas Logistics A settlement offer that includes minor tariff changes will be provided to the parties in the proceeding this week Although this will buy some time a scope and cost estimate needs to be determined so that if the modification above is offered we know what the cost is Alma Please schedule a hour meeting with anyone on the distribution and if anyone else should be included please let Alma know Brad
Personal Best Award RequestHere is the PAA for Legale Add additional information if you do not think this is meaty enough I do not have Larrys P and Social Security Brad

Customer Service Concerns from NNG Customer Meeting September Attached is the compilation of customer comments from the NNG customer meeting I have made a rough attempt at categorizing them Many of these concerns were discussed in the process improvement sessions There will be follow up meetings to prioritize and address these issues this week Please take some time to review these comments

System Enhancements for Feedback at NNG Winter Ops MeetingAttached is the prioritization list of the system enhancements from this mornings meeting As we discussed the estimated timetable to implement these changes will be before the end of the year If there are delays in any of these items whereby a December deadline cant be met please let me know ASAP We intend to communicate to customers early next year as to our progress on these items and other customer service enhancements In addition I have attached the first set of FAQs that will be distributed to customers and posted on the website

PAAs for Kathy and Lynda Cc Shelley My team recommended that Kathy and Lynda received these for their testing efforts during the identified projects Let me know if you need additional information Brad
Personal Best Award RequestHere is the PAA for Legale Add additional information if you do not think this is meaty enough I do not have Larrys P and Social Security Brad
Final review Cc Debbie Im going through some final reviews However since my morning is booked Im going to send the presentation now There might be minor changes but probably not significant Brad

Business Objects Training Cc You have been identified to participate in the Business Objects trainingknowledge sharing Don Powell and Ken Powers have agreed to train and to share their knowledge regarding Business Objects The session will cover the following Inventory of commonly used Universes and their data structure hours Description of the canned reports that currently exist and how they are being used hours QA and assistance in developing reports hours Please bring a list of needed reports from your respective areas to develop in the days or weeks immediately following the class The expectation on the session timing is within the next six weeks Don and Ken will work with Mike Bodnar to set up the session Gas Logistics goal is to develop individuals that can create complex reports using Business Objects and reduce its reliance on IT and Don in developing such reports If you have any questions please contact me or your Director

Business Objects Training Cc The following individuals have been identified for the trainingknowledge sharing that was discussed at this weeks meeting Randy Bryan Mike Bodnar Legale Black Richard Hanagriff Alice Johnson Dennis Lee and Jim Studebaker As discussed the session will cover the following Inventory of commonly used Universes and their data structure hours Description of the canned reports that currently exist and how they are being used hours QA and assistance in developing reports hours This was not discussed but I think this would be a valuable use of time The GL directors agreed that along with notifying these individuals that they will receive further Business Objects training they are to bring a list of needed reports from their respective areas to develop in the days or weeks immediately following the class Gas Logistics goal is to develop individuals that can create complex reports using Business Objects and reduce its reliance on IT and Don in developing such reports Please let us know when you think you will be able to hold the session Our expectation on timing is within the next six weeks Mike Bodnar will be the lead from Gas Logisitics so please rely on him for support

Updated Rates and Revenue SystemDue to scheduling conflicts this meeting has been moved to am Wednesday June

In late Out early Cc Peggy is going to Dallas this afternoon through Saturday I will be putting the girls on the bus and getting them off That means I will be in around and leaving around starting this afternoon Ill be available by cell or Blackberry Brad

RE Performance ReviewIll work with Ricki to set up a time Original Message From Corman Shelley Sent Thu PM To Holmes Bradley Cc Subject Performance Review Brad Attached are the written comments that I prepared while I was traveling Let me know when you would like to sit down and talk both about and directions for holmes braddoc

Critical Business Applications for Customer Communications and TransactionsShelley Attached is the start of the communications plan There are many more issues to cover but the balance will be how much detail to provide executives Let me know where you want to go from here Brad I will be sending this to the group Scott A Jean M Toby John B Kim P for further comments

Agreement Signatures Cc Steve and I have been asked whether we will be signing the documents that you previously signed or whether they should continue to go you If the officer status is not required for TPAs Electronic Information Access Transportation Contracts etc wed be happy to pick up the responsibility Let us know which direction youd like to go and we will inform the group Brad

RE Vacation plansMy vacation plans for the first quarter are February and th March through the th Brad Original Message From Blair Lynn Sent Friday January PM To Dietz Rick Nacey Sheila Bryant Mike Corman Shelley Holmes Bradley January Steve Scott Donna Cc Blair Lynn Subject RE Vacation plans The only vacation I have scheduled so far is February th March and th Thanks Lynn Original Message From Dietz Rick Sent Tuesday January PM To Nacey Sheila Blair Lynn Bryant Mike Corman Shelley Holmes Bradley January Steve Scott Donna Subject RE Vacation plans Shelley Following up on Sheilas message my planned vacation for the first half of is as follows March th th June th th and a few other scattered days on a oneday only basis Rick Original Message From Nacey Sheila Sent Tuesday January AM To Blair Lynn Bryant Mike Corman Shelley Dietz Rick Holmes Bradley January Steve Scott Donna Subject Vacation plans Shelley the following details my vacation plans for the first half of Feb thru Apr thru and June thru Sheila
